item.title: Class and instance
item.description:
Class and instance #

A class can be viewed as a blueprint for a set of similar objects.

For instance, consider the two objects:

```javascript { name: "Florence", zipCode: 50100, region: "Tuscany" } ```
```javascript { name: "Rome", zipCode: 00100, region: "Lazio" } ```

Each of these objects describes a city, and they share the same keys (name, zipCode and region). A possible class for these two objects may enforce this structure, and it could be named City. An object that follows this blueprint is called an instance of this class.
